org.springframework.social.security

Class SpringSocialConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurerAdapter<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
      • org.springframework.social.security.SpringSocialConfigurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurer<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>

    public class SpringSocialConfigurer
extends org.springframework.security.config.annotation.SecurityConfigurerAdapter<org.springframework.security.web.DefaultSecurityFilterChain,org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity>
    Configurer that adds SocialAuthenticationFilter to Spring Security's filter chain. Used with Spring Security 3.2's Java-based configuration support, when overriding WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter#configure(HttpSecurity): 
     protected void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {
   http.
     // HTTP security configuration details snipped
     .and()
        .apply(new SpringSocialConfigurer());
 }

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpringSocialConfigurer()
      Constructs a SpringSocialConfigurer.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SpringSocialConfigurer alwaysUsePostLoginUrl(boolean alwaysUsePostLoginUrl)
      If true, always redirect to postLoginUrl, even if a pre-signin target is in the request cache.
      void configure(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) 
      SpringSocialConfigurer connectionAddedRedirectUrl(String connectionAddedRedirectUrl)
      Sets the URL to land on after an a connection was added.
      SpringSocialConfigurer postFailureUrl(String postFailureUrl)
      Sets the URL to redirect to if authentication fails or if authorization is denied by the user.
      SpringSocialConfigurer postLoginUrl(String postLoginUrl)
      Sets the URL to land on after a successful login.
      SpringSocialConfigurer signupUrl(String signupUrl)
      Sets the URL to land on after an authentication failure so that the user can register with the application.
      SpringSocialConfigurer userIdSource(UserIdSource userIdSource)
      Sets the UserIdSource to use for authentication.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpringSocialConfigurer

        public SpringSocialConfigurer()
        Constructs a SpringSocialConfigurer. Requires that UsersConnectionRepository, SocialAuthenticationServiceLocator, and SocialUserDetailsService beans be available in the application context.

      • userIdSource

        public SpringSocialConfigurer userIdSource(UserIdSource userIdSource)
        Sets the UserIdSource to use for authentication. Defaults to AuthenticationNameUserIdSource.
        Parameters:
        userIdSource - the UserIdSource to use when authenticating
        Returns:
        this SpringSocialConfigurer for chained configuration

      • postLoginUrl

        public SpringSocialConfigurer postLoginUrl(String postLoginUrl)
        Sets the URL to land on after a successful login.
        Parameters:
        postLoginUrl - the URL to redirect to after a successful login
        Returns:
        this SpringSocialConfigurer for chained configuration

      • alwaysUsePostLoginUrl

        public SpringSocialConfigurer alwaysUsePostLoginUrl(boolean alwaysUsePostLoginUrl)
        If true, always redirect to postLoginUrl, even if a pre-signin target is in the request cache.
        Parameters:
        alwaysUsePostLoginUrl - if true, always redirect to the postLoginUrl
        Returns:
        this SpringSocialConfigurer for chained configuration

      • postFailureUrl

        public SpringSocialConfigurer postFailureUrl(String postFailureUrl)
        Sets the URL to redirect to if authentication fails or if authorization is denied by the user.
        Parameters:
        postFailureUrl - the URL to redirect to after an authentication fail or authorization deny
        Returns:
        this SpringSocialConfigurer for chained configuration

      • signupUrl

        public SpringSocialConfigurer signupUrl(String signupUrl)
        Sets the URL to land on after an authentication failure so that the user can register with the application.
        Parameters:
        signupUrl - the URL to redirect to after an authentication failure
        Returns:
        this SpringSocialConfigurer for chained configuration
